data.text:
From an earlier tweet…

“To be scientifically literate is to empower yourself….”

Weekly image & link to a T-shirt. Conceived & designed by fans. Approved by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/6ihjONkS40 https://t.co/p0stNYWkp4

A pernicious source of bad decisions in our lives…

Knowing just enough about a topic to think you’re right, but not enough to know you’re wrong.

@YakAtttack The Sun also raises tides on Earth, right now at about 1/3 the strength of the Moon’s. That will continue.

FYI: The very high tides during Full Moon have nothing to do with the Moon itself.  Its bcause that’s when the Sun’s tides add directly to the Moon’s, making them larger.

“To all those who are both curious & restless, in search of our place in the universe.”

Might that be you?  Or someone you know?

Dedication in the book Cosmic Queries
https://t.co/S18uIRwISF https://t.co/27pxbBYGbh
@MechanicaFrog Hmm. Looks like you don’t follow my Twitter account.  That Coronavorus tweet might be my tenth on the subject, beginning in March 2020.

If you are refusing to get vaccinated against COVID-19, maybe it's because you are getting your medical advice from news pundits, fearmongers, conspiracy theorists, and other deeply misinformed people, rather than from Medical Professionals. https://t.co/TY9KYtY8pl

Not to worry, the Moon’s been spiraling away from us for nearly 4.5 billion years, shortly after the Solar System was born.

Back then,the Moon was in-your-face: It orbited Earth every 8 hours, was 20x closer, 400x larger on the sky, and forced tides 8,000x stronger than today. https://t.co/JgiYizWhRx

Long suspected of receding from Earth, the Moon received five corner-reflectors positioned by American & Soviet missions, starting with Apollo 11 in 1969.

These special mirrors allow us to measure the Moon’s distance accurately & routinely using lasers. 

It’s indeed moving away https://t.co/bCF5mvM53Q

Right now, the Moon, in its orbit, is spiraling away from Earth by about the width of two fingers every year. 

Just thought you might want to know this. https://t.co/SoQsU3abHp

Mother's Day Wisdom...
Does my Mom have any regrets, in her 90+ years of life? [25 sec]

[Full Video: 35 mins]
https://t.co/wkV8s4GNdJ https://t.co/zVLRZfdGL9

NEWS FLASH: Astrophysicists recently discovered a planet in the Galaxy populated entirely by semi-autonomous Robots.

It’s called Mars.

LANDERS: Viking 1 & 2, Phoenix, InSight, Mars-3. ROVERS: Sojourner, Spirit, Opportunity, Curiosity, Perseverance, Zhurong. COPTER: Ingenuity. https://t.co/VBlTxUna2B

@chazglen Perhaps you missed this tweet:

https://t.co/sut3AX9ykE

@LeviPlasma Every machine we have ever made, theorized, or observed, loses some amount of energy to heat. That’s why, for example, your car engine gets hot during use.

Perpetual motion requires these heat losses to be zero, and so we’ve never observed perpetual motion.
@Chirino89M @Apple @StarTalkRadio Nice. If true, then you’re between 31 and 32 years old.  We should all hope to live 3-billion seconds.

On this, #StarWarsDay, I offer a Baby Yoda’fied version of:

“The good thing about science is that it’s true whether or not you believe in it.”

Shirt conceived & designed by fans. Approved by me. After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational orgs.

https://t.co/kFwwQhxZJH https://t.co/mTiWo0gKt0
May the fourth be with you.
@robertpowell88 See the Tweet just before that one!

@12253102 Since you don’t follow me, you surely missed the Tweet that followed that one by mere miinutes.

https://t.co/sut3AX9ykE
@TalisonComics Hmm. Didn’t know about that one. Thanks.  But in both cases the exhibit was bigger than you. And that’s the lesson here.

In my other life, I host the @StarTalkRadio podcast.  Which has been nominated for a People’s Choice Webby Award.

Here’s @ChuckNiceComic alerting me of this fact.

[Video: 2 mins] https://t.co/Lrg0LY8fO8

@monu473 Thanks for your interest.   Been writing mostly books lately, but here is my research publication list... 
https://t.co/qPUvzi1Z9r
@PaulCYallop Is it really any weirder than grated cheese on chili?
That’s how you do that. https://t.co/9oMkdfESwl
@GodlessSmilodon : - )

“Y'all Need Vaccine”

(First posted in February, but looks like I need to post this a second time.)

My weekly image & link to a T-shirt. Conceived & designed by fans. Approved by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/IMf0ispB6q https://t.co/HIXH702Bvx
@Seamus1014 @BabaBrinkman @Ellect217 I see what you did there.
@BabaBrinkman @Ellect217 Looks like the arrows are irrelevant to the effect.  So no power of suggestion needed.
@stivinet @NASA Needlessly aerodynamic, I would say.
Don’t tell anybody, but I never returned my Mars dune-buggy loaner to @NASA.  Maybe I should — sometimes it’s hard to find parking. https://t.co/OzAX5DevzJ
@harman_geoff Indeed. A fact that forces one to pause — and reflect on the frailty of our existence.
@thedaveygshow I see what you did there.

As the lone occupant of Apollo 11’s Command Module, in 1969 he was officially the most isolated human there ever was, while in orbit over the Moon’s far side — 2,200 miles from Neil & Buzz, themselves bounding in the Sea of Tranquility

Godspeed Michael Collins (1930 - 2021) https://t.co/MBGob3cuza

“We Are Stardust”

Why? Chemical elements in our bodies are traceable to the life & death of stars.

Weekly image & link to a T-shirt. Conceived & designed by fans. Sanctioned by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/TTiN4Vig5u https://t.co/E6ijXubpRc

Resident of NYC and not yet vaccinated? Can now get a walk-in COVID Vaccine at the American Museum of Natural History’s Hall of Ocean Life. Apparently our Blue Whale is a bonafide resident of the city, and got the vaccine first, in her left “shoulder”.

https://t.co/wCdyqZt1Yz https://t.co/bhNVvxKuX1

Some of you asked:

A quarter-pounder (pre-cooked) burger on Mars would weigh 10.5 ounces back on Earth — 2.6 times as much.

But, apparently, watch out for the Fries. Mark Watney [Matt Damon] may be their farmer, growing poop-potatoes. https://t.co/caoGwYpwgK
First signs of life on Mars, from @NASA’s #ingenuity helicopter, or not. https://t.co/WIN5HtIyhO

How big is a Zillion, you ask?

Not sure. But I think it's a 1000 times larger than a Squillion, but only 1/1000th of a Gajillion.

And we have top people still trying to figure out the true size of a Bazillion.

@biancabonet1 @option8 @StarTalkRadio My bad.  Gajillion it is.

But add in the multiverse, and you get a bazillion.

@bhumikaefv @StarTalkRadio Expensive, but I'm thinking this book:

https://t.co/NKV2SaZp3L

Delighted to learn that of the zillion podcasts in the universe, @StarTalkRadio has been nominated for a People’s Choice “Best of” Webby Award, in the category of Science & Education.

No need to be a “Member of the Academy” to vote for your own favorite:
https://t.co/lW3pgY7SxV
Maybe every day should be Earth Day.
@MehulJayswal12 Good one.  Thanks.

It’s well known:

What flat-Earthers fear most is Sphere itself. https://t.co/f2j1EQrDEf
The #MarsHelicopter is badass. https://t.co/jQEUH3pKrf

“I’m going through a phase”

How much do you have in common with the Moon?

Weekly image & link to a T-shirt. conceived & designed by fans. Sanctioned by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/3hwzu0yDPS https://t.co/ZUl3n9n70L
The urge to repeat an aphorism is often greater than the need for it to be true.

What pigs do when we are not slaughtering them for food…

Future spectator sport -- the Pig Olympics. https://t.co/lSCMQ7MMvI
@DavidFromDavis @steak_umm An innocent derailment.  Steak-umm doesn’t follow me, so they didn’t see my subsequent Tweet, which was much less forwarded than the first one.

@DavidFromDavis @steak_umm FYI: Posted minutes after the Tweet in question.

https://t.co/sut3AX9ykE
@TumorBob @steak_umm Won't argue that. Then read it whey you’re done eating. It can wait.
@BobbleHeadGuru @steak_umm Thanks.  I’m dating science as it’s now practiced, from 1600 onward.  At that time Earth was exeperimentally and observationally demostrated to be round.

@PictureTheSouth @steak_umm Somebody didn’t see the tweet that **immediatly** followed the one in question.

https://t.co/sut3AX9ykE
Are we wise enough to shepherd the future of our own civilization?

Fun with electricity…

Depending on make & model, those six listed items (see previous Tweet) each draw between 1,500 & 2,000 Watts.  That’s 9,000 to 12,000 Watts total).  Since  Watts = Volts x Amps, and the UK uses 230Volt circuits, to blow a 50-Amp fuse requires 11,500 Watts. https://t.co/Y32vOltK14

@LukeInSoCo @RollingStone Startup current draws are higher, sometimes by a factor of two.  But if you review the range of running power comnsumption for the list, you’ll see that the totals come out just about right for UK Voltage.

If you plugged into the same electrical circuit and simultaneously ran a Toaster, a Hair Dryer on high, a Chain Saw, Lawn Mower, Leaf Blower, and a Winch, only then might you “blow a 50-Amp fuse” as warned in the @RollingStone’s (1969) hit “You Can’t Always Get What You Want.”
ALERT:  A weirdly obscure, unapologetically Geeky fact that involves The Rolling Stones, follows…

@sudden_diarrhea @samuelhaycraft @painfulgas1 Somebody didn’t read this 4-min essay:

https://t.co/VnIS6kuSkS

@ErikEvenson @mikestinctively @Againsttrollin @UFCFightHub @StarTalkRadio Excellent and important point.  But I try not to argue word definitions in ways that over-ride larger ideas. For example, when asked how much of Earth’s surface is covered by the oceans, I presume your answer is not “none”.
@ErikEvenson @mikestinctively @Againsttrollin @UFCFightHub @StarTalkRadio Salt-water does quite well.
@PMagcub You missed an earlier tweet.  Not your fault.  Just letting you know.

Inspired by an earlier tweet…

“Science is true whether or not you believe in it.”

Weekly image & link to swag. This, from StarTalk’s Fanjoy storefront. 

Proceeds support @StarTalkRadio’s educational programming mission.

https://t.co/LoiskDxpiH https://t.co/frMjP7m8gt

@michaer27 @gotbeemans Of possible interest:
“Stick-In-the-Mud Astronomy”

[Text 2,000 words; 8 mins]
https://t.co/WRl4xry5MB
@KazumaTRX Unfortunately, that’s an excellent point.
The good thing about Science is that it’s true, whether or not you believe in it.
@Danner72 I see what you did there.
@moissuperman @itsRicoche Hot Steam.

There’s a pervasive chemical in the environment that’s a potent solvent. Found in acid rain, it will asphyxiate you if it enters your lungs. Its vapors can cause 2nd degree burns, it’s a greenhouse gas, and it’s also found in most foods.

That chemical is called…

Water.

@CaptSparrow14 Perhaps you already noticed — one of that book's chapters: “The Beginning of Science” is on that very subject.

https://t.co/mReCh6Fd8r

More of what Cows do when we’re not eating them.

https://t.co/cQtnjpRGg6

If interested, I was recently interviewed by @WalterIsaacson on @PBS’s @camanpour & Company, addressing some deep, unanswered questions about the universe.

[Video.  18min]
https://t.co/kU2wgXCM8u
Not that anybody asked but if, in fact, anti-pasta were the antimatter counterpart to pasta, then a serving bowl of each, when mixed, would generate a 20-Megaton nuclear blast.

Physicists have long suspected the real reason why Italian restaurants never serve pasta with the anti-pasta course —  if the two ever combined they might spontaneously annihilate, creating pure energy, ruining your dinner. https://t.co/lcQBhjmBLl
@pkobly yuup.  It happens sometimes.
Geeky, dad-joke alert…

Done it many times, but always thought it odd that Easter, the holiest day on the Christian calendar, commemorating the resurrection of Jesus, is commonly celebrated by eating chocolate effigies of Bunny Rabbits and boiling, decorating, then hiding Chicken embryos from children. https://t.co/uIE8W4gH1u

From an earlier tweet…

“The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.”

Weekly image & link to a Tee-shirt. Conceived & designed by fans. Approved by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/XeRZyqr9bq https://t.co/rHIfpIQHxP

@TheRambler14 Perhaps.

But it doesn’t proclaim restrictions on your sexual preference or who you can marry.
The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.

For those among you who, after all these years, still carry a grudge about my role in Pluto’s demotion, please know that since then, Pluto & I have become good friends.

So if Pluto can handle the truth, so can you. https://t.co/DqKqUH56qS

@deaerti @BritPakOnline @Bellpipe41 @MindfulDamage @jimmbizzle @tracy_1776 @TakeThatDarwin @rhysc89 @RichardDawkins @ProfBrianCox Pulsars don’t make sounds.

They emit a melange of electromagnetic pulses. So your comment is akin to beholding a photo or video and remarking,  "look at all that detail."

@tarlisportela I hear you.  I tried to help:

https://t.co/unqeZfo3j0

Never knew that cat-crunches were a thing.

Or maybe it’s early fitness-prep for when they take over the world and become our overlords.

https://t.co/p5QIS2HtMB

“Let’s Make America Smart Again”. 

I’m just saying.

Weekly image & link to a Tee-shirt. Conceived & designed by fans. Sanctioned by me.

After fees to the artist, proceeds go to educational organizations.

https://t.co/rQqGf4P7Cm https://t.co/oVdMtjVd8z

@GJGrubb Yup.  Or rather, to never coincide with Passover, which it was at risk of doing before the Gregorian jump-start of the calendar - itself correcting for the ten excess leap days that had accumulated.

Today, March 28, 2021, just missed being Easter Sunday.

Rules of the Gregorian Calendar (begun in 1582) place Easter on the first Sunday AFTER the first Full Moon AFTER the March Equinox.

Full Moon occurrs today, not yesterday, so Easter must wait another week. And it will. https://t.co/iK497Y1yaR

@ElijahMrLove @skdh Precisely.

If the base of your ship is where you want your “gravity” to manifest, then truning it around and decelerating in your direction of motion creates exactly the same sensation as accelerating while moving “forward”.
With Google & Apple maps, we’ve lost the radio voices of Traffic Reporters.  Thanks Jon, for hilariously reminding us all of your craft. https://t.co/oeh1OKA2Jz
@FarFarOutThere Thanks. To be precise (and accurate) I shoiuld have said “Historical” Latin names.

I kinda like “Luna”, our Moon's offical name.

And while we’re at it, the official name of our Sun is “Sol”, and Earth, “Terra”. https://t.co/OfRC8iEUi3
@Jayzwatching Yup.  A Classic.

@kartik_k9r @CenterRotation Very good point. That was callous and presumptive of me.  

I’ll offer here the last three pages of the book, which hint at some of those deep questions — to tide you over until you pay back your medschool loans. https://t.co/HRbBlGfhqC

@CenterRotation Hate to do it this way, but if y’all are surgeons, you can afford to buy the book: Cosmic Queries.

https://t.co/S18uIRwISF https://t.co/dh9LPQm9wQ

Indeed, across Earth..
Philosophy + Science = Hammer Time

But personally, if I were an MC, I’d want to be "MC-Squared”.  

That works across the universe. https://t.co/vE9hifV59b

@Eduede1 @MCHammer Thanks for your note. My views on the subject are more nuanced than are typically reflected in the media. This clip summarizes them best, I think.

https://t.co/0a17vgQbLA
